conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph of objects A and B to determine the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2.
Velocity is the slope of the graph, and acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
For object A, the velocity increases linearly from t1 to t2.
Acceleration of object A is constant and equal to the slope of the velocity graph.
For object B, the velocity decreases from t1 to t2.
Acceleration of object B is negative, as it is the derivative of the velocity graph.
Since the acceleration is negative, the direction of motion is downward, and object B is slowing down over the time interval 0 to t2.
Determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2. Since the acceleration is negative, the acceleration decreases over time.
Conclude that the acceleration of object B decreases from t1 to t2.
Since the acceleration is decreasing, the velocity of object B also decreases over time.
Conclude that the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is decreasing.
